command.name: _complete
command.description: Internal command to provide shell completion suggestions
command.help: Internal command to provide shell completion suggestions

option.name: --shell
option.description: The shell type ("bash", "fish", "zsh")

option.name: --input
option.description: An array of input tokens (e.g. COMP_WORDS or argv)

option.name: --current
option.description: The index of the "input" array that the cursor is in (e.g. COMP_CWORD)

option.name: --api-version
option.description: The API version of the completion script

option.name: --symfony
option.description: deprecated

option.name: --help
option.description: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the <info>list</info> command

option.name: --quiet
option.description: Do not output any message

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --version
option.description: Display this application version

option.name: --ansi
option.description: Force (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output

option.name: --no-ansi
option.description: Negate the "--ansi" option

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

option.name: --env
option.description: The environment the command should run under

command.name: completion
command.help:
The <info>completion</> command dumps the shell completion script required to use shell autocompletion (currently, bash, fish, zsh completion are supported).
<comment>Static installation -------------------</>
Dump the script to a global completion file and restart your shell:
<info>hyde completion | sudo tee /etc/bash_completion.d/hyde</>
Or dump the script to a local file and source it:
<info>hyde completion > completion.sh</>
<comment># source the file whenever you use the project</> <info>source completion.sh</>
<comment># or add this line at the end of your "~/.bashrc" file:</> <info>source /path/to/completion.sh</>
<comment>Dynamic installation --------------------</>
Add this to the end of your shell configuration file (e.g. <info>"~/.bashrc"</>):
<info>eval "$(H:\hyde-global\hyde completion )"</>

argument.name: shell
argument.description: The shell type (e.g. "bash"), the value of the "$SHELL" env var will be used if this is not given

option.name: --debug
option.description: Tail the completion debug log

option.name: --help
option.description: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the <info>list</info> command

option.name: --quiet
option.description: Do not output any message

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --version
option.description: Display this application version

option.name: --ansi
option.description: Force (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output

option.name: --no-ansi
option.description: Negate the "--ansi" option

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

option.name: --env
option.description: The environment the command should run under

command.name: help
command.help:
The <info>help</info> command displays help for a given command:
<info>hyde help list</info>
You can also output the help in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:
<info>hyde help --format=xml list</info>
To display the list of available commands, please use the <info>list</info> command.

option.name: --format
option.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --raw
option.description: To output raw command help

option.name: --help
option.description: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the <info>list</info> command

command.name: list
command.help:
The <info>list</info> command lists all commands:
<info>hyde list</info>
You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:
<info>hyde list test</info>
You can also output the information in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:
<info>hyde list --format=xml</info>
It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):
<info>hyde list --raw</info>

option.name: --raw
option.description: To output raw command list

option.name: --format
option.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --short
option.description: To skip describing commands' arguments

option.description: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the <info>list</info> command
